text: There is a Jorge Luis Borges short story in which an empire of cartography tries to create a map so exact that it has the same size of the country itself: <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/On_Exactitude_in_Science>

attachments.title: On Exactitude in Science
attachments.text: "On Exactitude in Science" or "On Rigor in Science" (the original Spanish-language title is "Del rigor en la ciencia") is a one-paragraph short story written in 1946 by Jorge Luis Borges, about the map‚Äìterritory relation, written in the form of a literary forgery.

text: But seriously, my impression it that these days it is not easy at all to make money on financial markets, unless you have a really large asset base and/or have acesss to insider information. That's why other markets, such as land or housing, are so  heated these days. There the returns are much larger.
